title: NASA to Discuss Status of Next Artemis I Moon Mission Launch Attempt
summary: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 11 a.m. EDT Thursday, Sept. 8, to discuss next steps for the Artemis I mission to launch the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and Orion spacecraft from the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

title: NASA Taps Axiom Space for First Artemis Moonwalking Spacesuits
summary: NASA has selected Axiom Space to deliver a moonwalking system for the Artemis III mission, which will land Americans on the surface of the Moon for the first time in over 50 years. This award – the first one under a competitive spacesuits contract – is for a task order to develop a next generation Artemis spacesuit and supporting systems, and to de

title: NASA Awards Contract for Marshall’s Mission Operations
summary: NASA has awarded the Marshall Operations Systems, Services, and Integration II (MOSSI II) contract to Teledyne Brown Engineering Inc. of Huntsville, Alabama.

title: GAO: Defense, intelligence agencies need a better plan to buy commercial satellite imagery
summary: U.S. defense and intelligence agencies are not taking advantage of available commercial imagery due to slow and cumbersome procurement methods, said a GAO report.

title: NASA to repair Artemis 1 moon rocket’s leaky hydrogen connector at launch pad
summary: Technicians at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center will repair a leak in a liquid hydrogen fueling line on the Artemis 1 moon rocket the launch pad rather than inside the Vehicle Assembly Building, a decision the agency says will enable teams to test the repair under cryogenic conditions.

title: Ariane 5 to launch advanced broadband satellite for Eutelsat
summary: Europe’s Ariane 5 rocket will return to action Tuesday, deploying a high-power communications satellite for French operator Eutelsat. Liftoff from the Centre Spatial Guyanais in Kourou, French Guiana is scheduled for 6:45 p.m. EDT (21:45 UTC) with the opening of a 66-minute launch window.

title: India’s Skyroot Aerospace raises $51 million ahead of inaugural launch
summary: Skyroot Aerospace says the round will fund “infrastructure and initial developmental launches, enabling us to achieve commercial operations next year.”

title: Near Space Labs offers free imagery for researchers
summary: Near Space Labs announced plans Sept. 7 to provide free high-resolution Earth imagery to researchers, universities and nonprofit organizations.

title: BAE Systems developing multi-sensor satellite cluster for military intelligence
summary: BAE Systems said Sept. 7 it is developing its first multi-sensor satellite cluster to gather intelligence for military and disaster response needs in 2024.

title: Albedo announces $48 million Series A funding round
summary: Earth observation startup Albedo raised $48 million in a Series A funding round.
